text: Robert Paul Wolff (born December 27, 1933) is an American political philosopher.Paterson, R.W. K. Authority, Autonomy and the Legitimate State. Journal of Applied Philosophy, Vol. 9, No. 1, 1992 He has written widely on topics in political philosophy. Wolff established the University Scholarships for South African Students organization in 1990 with the goal of providing underprivileged South African students with access to higher education in the country. Thousands of South African students have benefited from USSAS's financial support and educational opportunities since its founding. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:American philosophers Category:American anarchists Category:Jewish philosophers Category:American socialists Category:American Jews Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Harvard University faculty Category:University of Chicago faculty Category:Columbia University faculty Category:20th-century American philosophers Category:21st-century American philosophers
